com.affectiva.android.affdex.sdk.detector

Class Detector

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.affectiva.android.affdex.sdk.detector.Detector

  • public class Detector
extends java.lang.Object
    Welcome to the Affdex SDK for Android! With this SDK, your app will be able to detect facial expressions using the built-in camera, or via a file on your device.

    Enjoy the SDK!

    This class utilizes Affdex's facial expression detection capabilities by analyzing video frames and returning the expressions in each frame. The Detector class analyzes successive video frames in order to measure the number and degree of facial expressions of the subject. Depending upon the initialization method used, the video frames may come from either the built-in camera of the device, via a file on the device, or pushed to the engine through a method.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Detector

        public Detector(Context context,
        Detector.Detection detectorCallback,
        Detector.CameraType camera,
        SurfaceView cameraPreviewView)
        Initializes the Detector for processing video from a camera. This method initializes the Affdex facial expression engine and prepares it to receive video frames from the camera on the device. The caller specifies which camera (front or back) will be used to capture the frames.

        Notes:

        • The object "owns" the camera device and will not relinquish it until the object is deallocated.
        • Using the specified SurfaceView is much more efficient than using the returned images in the Detector.Detection.onImageResults(List, Frame, double) callback..
        Parameters:
        detectorCallback - Receives messages from this Detector instance.
        camera - An enumerated value indicating which camera (front or back)
        cameraPreviewView - a SurfaceView to use as a camera preview, null to let the SDK uses an internal one. When not null, if face points are requested, points will be oriented to the rotation of the camera preview view.
        context - application's context.

      • Detector

        public Detector(Context context,
        Detector.Detection detectorCallback,
        boolean discreteImages)
        Initializes the Detector for processing video from a file.

        This method initializes the Affdex facial expression engine and prepares it to receive video frames from a file on the device. The caller specifies the name of the movie file that contains the video to be processed.

        Parameters: detectorCallback

        Parameters:
        context - application's context.
        detectorCallback - receives messages from this Detector instance.
        discreteImages - true if Frames passed are expected to be unrelated (static images mode), false if they are spread over time (push mode).

      • Detector

        public Detector(Context context,
        Detector.Detection detectorCallback,
        java.lang.String filePath)
        Initializes the Detector for processing video frames or single images pushed by the caller.

        This method initializes the Affdex facial expression engine and prepares it to receive video frames pushed from the caller.

        Parameters:
        context - application's context.
        detectorCallback - receives messages from this Detector instance.
        filePath - the path on the SD card to the video file.

    • Method Detail

      • processImage

        public void processImage(Frame facePicture)
        Asks the Detector to process the passed facePicture as a discrete image.

        This method is used with the constructor that does not specify a file or camera type. Callers may pass frames to this method at any rate that is suitable for them. The detector expects subsequent frames to be unrelated to previous frames (e.g. a series of still photos).

        Note: Only works in single images mode.

        Parameters:
        facePicture - A Frame object to process. Must be right side up: use rotateImage before calling.

      • processImage

        public void processImage(Frame facePicture,
                float timestampSec)
        Asks the Detector to process the passed facePicture. This method is used with the constructor that does not specify a file or camera type. Callers may pass frames to this method at any rate that is suitable for them. The detector expects subsequent frames to be related to previous frames (e.g. a video stream).

        Note: Only works in push mode.

        Parameters:
        facePicture - A Frame object to process. Must be right side up: use rotateImage before calling.
        timestampSec - A timestamp, in seconds, expected to be larger than the previous call to this method.

      • start

        public java.lang.String start()
        Starts the detection process. Processing frames from the camera or a file: calling this method will begin the processing of frames. Pushing frames: call this method once before calling processImage() to initialize the detector.
        Returns:
        A null return value means no error, otherwise, the error description is returned in the String.

      • stop

        public java.lang.String stop()
        Stops the detection process. When a detector receives this message, it will stop processing frames. Will release the Camera in camera mode.
        Returns:
        null if stopped successfully; the error description is returned in the String otherwise.
        See Also:
        DetectorAPI.getPercentFaceDetected()

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Returns the state of the detector.
        Returns:
        true if Detector is running; false otherwise.

      • setClassifierOn

        public boolean setClassifierOn(Detector.Classifier classifier,
                      boolean setOn)
        Enable or disable a Classifier, which determines whether this metric gets included in the list returned by Detector.Detection.onImageResults(List, Frame, double). Classifiers are disabled by default.
        Parameters:
        classifier - the Classifier to change enable/disable.
        setOn - true to enable the specified Classifier; false to disable.
        Returns:
        true if operation finished successfully; false otherwise.

      • setReturnFacePoints

        public void setReturnFacePoints(boolean setOn)
        Enable or disable returning face points, disabled by default.
        Parameters:
        setOn - to enable returning face points every processed frame.
        See Also:
        Detector.Detection.onImageResults(List, Frame, double)

      • getPercentFaceDetected

        public float getPercentFaceDetected()
        The percentage of time a face was detected (reset at every DetectorAPI.start()). Can only be called after DetectorAPI.stop().
        Returns:
        the percentage of the face detected of the processed frames.

      • setSendUnprocessedFrames

        public void setSendUnprocessedFrames(boolean sendUnprocessedFrameFlag)
        When the SDK is in control of the camera, if the SDK frame rate is lower than the camera frame rate, there will be frames that are not processed for expressions by the SDK.

        Note: Only effective when the SDK is in Camera Mode.

        Parameters:
        sendUnprocessedFrameFlag - Set this to true to receive unprocessed video frames.

      • setMaxProcessRate

        public void setMaxProcessRate(float maxFramesPerSecond)
        The maximum processing rate to operate in [FPS]. This will take effect after the next call to start().

        Default: 5 frames per second.

        Note: Only effective when the SDK is in Camera Mode.

        Parameters:
        maxFramesPerSecond - the maximum frames per second the SDK can process frames.

      • setLicensePath

        public void setLicensePath(java.lang.String licensePath)
                    throws LicenseException
        Call this with the relative path (under /assets/Affdex/) to the license file provided by Affectiva.
        Parameters:
        licensePath -
        Throws:
        LicenseException
